basics.name: Jordan Ball
basics.label: Data Scientist
basics.summary:
Jordan has earned degrees from the University of Florida and Louisiana State University. Before accepting a position in a data science training program, he quantitatively analyzed plasma thrusters, nuclear reactors, and materials. Through his role as an accountant and his business leadership courses, he has gained industry perspectives which complement his academic training. In addition, he has worked as a public relations officer, a peer mentor, and a teacher -- these roles have trained him to communicate effectively to audiences.

[Download Resume](../assets/img/docs/Resume.pdf)

work.summary: The University of Florida Nuclear Engineering program hosts Dr. Leigh Winfrey's plasma physics lab and Dr. Andreas Enqvist's detections lab. Jordan was a space nuclear propulsion and computational nuclear criticality researcher.
highlights: Rework codes to solve for propulsive properties of plasma flow within thruster
Using supercomputer nodes, computationally analyze nuclear reactor core data

work.summary: LSYOU is a tutoring program for At-Risk Youths. Students are bussed in from local high schools to the office where they are stocked on school supplies, fed, and tutored in their classes. Jordan was the sole accountant, and built a new accounting system which entirely eliminated inconsistincies which were common in the old system. This system replaced the Bursar's office system in addition to LSYOU's.
highlights: Handled approximately $1,000,000 annually in small daily charges spread across five grants
Rebuilt fully consistent accounting system and trained data entry personnel on its use

work.summary: The Condensed Matter Physics Group at LSU was, among other things, in charge of computationally  analyzing material properties. Jordan was the sole computational researcher in the group and was in charge of all computational analysis under the supervision of Dr. Dana Browne.
highlights: Computationally analyze materials via iterative methods to determine electric and magnetic properties
Compare theoretical data with the results from the experimental lab under Dr. John DiTusa

volunteer.summary: National program to get scientists and data analysts involved in politics--the goal is to promote science based policies.
Coordinated physics department activities and mentored newer students.
highlights: Frequently organized and led outreach events

courses: Capstone: Quantitative Analysis of Demographic Trends
Thesis, Upper-Division, Physics, and College Honors
